report_title: Learning Management Software in the US
executive_summary: Companies in the Learning Management Software industry offer software to track and manage online learning to assist in meeting objectives. Furthermore, operators in this industry may also offer online learning courses.

current_performance.current_performance_point_description: Over the five years to 2022, internet usage has risen significantly, illustrated by a 21.2% annualized growth in internet traffic volume. Further, an increasing number of households with computers also supported industry growth as more learners are able to access industry software.

The coronavirus outbreak that occurred in early 2020 had an asymmetrical effect on this industry. The shift towards remote learning amid the pandemic significantly increased demand for learning management software.
According to the EdWeek Research Center survey, 52.0% of 1,000 surveyed educators answered that the learning management system made teaching easier.
Industry demand is highly dependent on its downstream customer base, primarily comprising K-12 students and college students.

future_outlook.future_outlook_point_description: Over the five years to 2027, industry demand is expected to continue rising due to a recovery in the number of college students.
Nonetheless, many schools and universities still heavily rely on learning management systems to deliver instructions and manage academic materials.
Internet traffic volume is projected to continue supporting industry growth.
Industries are expected to expand their service offerings to international markets.

industry_definition: Companies in this industry offer software to track and manage online learning to assist in meeting objectives. Operators in this industry may also offer online learning courses.

mixed_impact_factors: Barriers To Entry Level: medium - increasing

opportunities: High Performance Drivers: Number of college students

key_trends: The price of computers has fallen steadily since their invention due to the highly competitive nature of circuit manufacturing and computer manufacturing
Due to growing revenue, new players have consistently joined the industry

market_segmentation.segment_description: Institutional clients represent the largest downstream market for this industry.
Consumers make up 26.2% of Learning Management Software industry revenue in 2022.
Demand from K-12 schools stagnated over the same period.
Demand from businesses has increased, primarily due to businesses' higher need to upskill their employees.

products_and_services.product_description: This model lets users gain access to learning management software directly on a web portal.
This segment represents revenue generated from customer training and consulting activities.

tier_1_suppliers: Design, Editing & Rendering Software Publishing in the US
tier_2_suppliers: Operating Systems & Productivity Software Publishing in the US
Computer Peripheral Manufacturing in the US

demand_determinants.determinant_description: Demand for operators in the Learning Management Software industry is heavily influenced by several factors.
Colleges use industry software to effectively assign, manage and assess students' work.

demand_determinants.determinant_title: Private investment in computers and software
demand_determinants.determinant_description: An increase in private investment in computers and software indirectly implies that more clients are willing to purchase industry software.

business_locations.location_description: The West region has a significantly higher share of industry establishments.
The Southeast region also has a slightly higher percentage of establishments.

regulations_points.regulation_description: The industry follows federal regulations on proper treatment of employees.
The industry is subject to federal copyright laws protecting proprietary technology.

barriers_points.barrier_description: The main barriers are the patents and dominant market share that major industry operators currently own.

basis_points.basis_description: Learning Management Software industry operators compete with each other based on prices, product range, product quality and after-sales service.

concentration_points.concentration_description: The top four leading companies account for over 70.0% of industry revenue in 2022.

cost_factors.cost_factor_description: Wage costs account for 38.5% of revenue in 2022 due to need for skilled software developers.

capital_intensity_points.capital_intensity_description: The industry has fairly low capital requirements.

volatility_points.volatility_description: Over the five years to 2022, revenue increased consistently every year.

technological_change_points.technological_change_description: Software has transitioned from physical distribution to downloadable and cloud-based, accessible over the internet.

FAQs.question: How has the shift towards conducting business online affected demand for your services?
FAQs.answer: The shift online has tremendously benefited the industry.
